Now using heritrix-1.5.0-200507200429.tar.gz, the command line extractor 
tool
is generating:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at 
org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorCSS.processStyleCode(ExtractorCSS.java:152)
        at 
org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorHTML.processStyle(ExtractorHTML.java:676)
        at 
org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorHTML.extract(ExtractorHTML.java:543)
        at 
org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorHTML.innerProcess(ExtractorHTML.java:465)
        at 
org.archive.crawler.framework.Processor.process(Processor.java:103)
        at 
org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorTool.extract(ExtractorTool.java:143)
        at 
org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorTool.main(ExtractorTool.java:263)

Have a couple different ARC's I can make available if needed.

stackarchiveorg wrote:

> Thanks for the below (and the ARC).  That helped.
>
> There's a fix in HEAD if you want to try it (Bug is
> http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=73833&atid=539099&func=detail&aid=1239155). 
> <http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=73833&atid=539099&func=detail&aid=1239155%29.>
>
> Yours,
> St.Ack
>
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Ryan Gran <ryan@c...> wrote:
> > I'm relatively new working with Heritrix, so please bear with me.
> >
> > Think I made some progress, but I'll let you be the judge of that.  If
> > you need additional debug
> > output, please put it in terms of arcreader/extractor (ARC HTTP
> > GETtable) isn't meaning
> > much to me yet. =)
> >
> > In any case:
> >
> > I dumped the index with arcreader:
> >
> > 20050712000538 72.22.69.24
> > http://baby-land-usa.com/amazon/type_browse/mode_509380/ text/html -
> > AWXCM4YK7M2EV7SSVQ6L732E6L63PX7S 702502 33235
> > LC-20050712000448-00068-lcs0001.local
> > 20050712000545 65.54.134.190
> >
> http://groups.msn.com/_Secure/0UgD!AhAarVzuTWgKhM7N81s*goD1Sp6WBvuJTifxpVz81OuknWvyMnUJXs2fxEiJuUUuz2bWtftiz18rgBKUqeSra5RuD5i1pS9V5ke1munGbnjNKs0MCJzWmnx9xb4z/background11.jpg?dc=4675391490255190516

>
> > no-type - JSK7KMF4PRWWNK7WREP55AASEVONFQJS 706489 289
> > LC-20050712000448-00068-lcs0001.local
> >
> > I thought baby-land-usa.com was the issue, but it extracts fine. 
> > However, the next entry (which would be about where extractor is dying):
> >
> > lcm:/Users/admin/heritrix-1.4.0/bin root# ./arcreader --format=dump
> > --offset=706489
> > /RAID01/1/1_job_1120859484/LC-20050712000448-00068-lcs0001.local.arc.gz
> > HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
> > Server: Microsoft-IIS/5.0

> > Srv:GRPWBD03
> > P3P:CP=BUS CUR CONo FIN IVDo ONL OUR PHY SAMo TELo

> > Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
> >         at
> > java.util.zip.InflaterInputStream.read(InflaterInputStream.java:122)
> >         at java.util.zip.GZIPInputStream.read(GZIPInputStream.java:87)
> >         at org.archive.io.arc.ARCRecord.read(ARCRecord.java:411)
> >         at
> > org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader.outputARCRecordDump(ARCReader.java:962)
> >         at
> org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader.outputARCRecord(ARCReader.java:936)
> >         at org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader.main(ARCReader.java:1146)
> >
> >
> > stack wrote:
> >
> > >
> > > So I think its issue w/ how extractor script is running through ARCs
> > > (First thing I'd try is removing the buffering of the gzip stream in
> > > HttpRecord#wrapInputStreamWithHttpRecord).  If you make the
> problematic
> > > ARC HTTP GETtable (You can send me the URL offlist), I'll take a
> look at
> > > it over on this end.
